executive_summary: The personal trainer industry derives demand from downstream consumer groups, with the 35-50 year old segment having the highest demand. Consumers with higher disposable income are more likely to purchase discretionary personal training services. Revenue is expected to grow at 3.3% CAGR to $12.9 billion through 2024 when profit reaches 12.8%. The industry continued growing during the pandemic by adapting to online workouts. Rising inflation and interest rates in 2024 caused a 0.8% revenue drop as consumers cut discretionary spending. Over the next five years to 2029, economic conditions are expected to improve, boosting demand for discretionary purchases like personal trainers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Obesity has taken center stage, encouraging health consciousness and intensifying demand for personal trainers as individuals aim for active, healthy lifestyles. Personal trainers have expanded services to attract individuals over 50.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shifting Age Demographics Benefits the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Growth in the 35-50 age group sustained demand in the early period as this group has higher disposable income for discretionary services. However, declining leisure time caused demand to slip later in the period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Personal Trainers are a Luxury Discretionary Service
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As an expensive discretionary service, demand is affected by disposable income levels. But personal trainers may not be as responsive as cheaper gym memberships due to the high costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Per Capita Disposable Income to Support Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic problems dissipate through 2029, rising disposable income is expected to increase demand for the discretionary personal trainer services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Obesity is on the Rise and Isn't Expected to Slow
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The prevalence of obesity will continue pushing health consciousness and demand for personal trainers. Government health initiatives like Healthy People 2030 will bolster recreation expenditure.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Shifting Landscape is Anticipated to Benefit Certain Segments
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in the 35-54 age group will bring more demand. An emerging childhood obesity market may also employ personal trainers, benefiting the industry.
As work-from-home policies end and commute times rise, employees will have less time for discretionary personal trainer services.

industry_definition: This industry includes individuals who offer one-on-one and small-group fitness training. Personal trainers may also provide personalized diet programs. Personal trainers are typically employed by gyms, fitness studios and hospitals, or they're self-employed. Large-group instructors and professional athletic trainers are not included.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady barriers to entry level

key_trends: The constant demand to stay healthy and active plays an integral role in establishing a competitive marketplace for industry clubs. As there is a significant overlap in consumer priorities, many personal trainers must go the extra mile to set themselves apart from the competition, which includes standard gyms.
The industry is fairly fragmented. Most operators are small businesses, typically run by nonemployers.
Per capita disposable income is the biggest indicator for industry performance. Heightened levels in 2020 helped stave off any decline in revenue.
Rising inflation will negatively affect the speed of the industry's growth. Consumers tend to cut discretionary spending like personal trainers when economic uncertainty increases.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Demand for personal training services for children and adolescents has grown due to the gradual phasing out of physical education programs at schools.
Consumers in this segment are interested in keeping fit, as appearing physically attractive is often a priority for these young consumers.
Consumers in this age range tend to have sufficient disposable income to spend on high-end gyms and discretionary services, such as personal training.
Consumers in this age range tend to have sufficient disposable income to spend on high-end gyms and discretionary services, such as personal training.
Most gyms with personal trainers now offer training programs specific to senior fitness.

products_and_services.product_description: Products in this segment include fitness-only health clubs, multipurpose health clubs, personal training gyms, yoga studios, Pilates studios and group exercise studios. Fitness centers make up almost half of the activity for personal training services, with trainers having access to all fitness center members.
Trainers in this segment offer their services to clients in their own personal gym.
Trainers in this segment offer their services to clients at home. The clients also benefit from not having to travel to a gym to get a personalized workout.

tier_1_suppliers: Athletic & Sporting Goods Manufacturing in the US
Gym & Exercise Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Sporting Goods Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Vitamin & Supplement Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Gym, Health & Fitness Clubs in the US
tier_2_buyers: Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The services provided by personal trainers are considered discretionary by most consumers. Demand for industry services is linked to per capita disposable income.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the most concentrated region in the US for personal trainer services, since this region also holds the highest percentage of the US population.
This region holds another sizable chunk of the total US population, allowing the West to hold a significant concentration of establishments.
With personal trainers operating in areas with high population centers, it would make sense for the Mid-Atlantic to capture a sizeable chunk of industry establishments.
Although the Great Lakers have a far less favorable climate, large population hubs in states like Illinois helped this region secure a decent size of personal trainers.

factors_decreased_barrier: There are few legal hurdles to overcome when entering the industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Demand for healthy and active lifestyle
basis_points.basis_description: The constant demand to stay healthy and active plays an integral role in establishing a competitive marketplace for industry clubs.
Many personal trainers must go the extra mile to set themselves apart from the competition.
The industry is fairly fragmented. Most operators are small businesses, typically run by nonemployers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry exhibits a low level of market concentration.
Due to the nature of the industry, there's very little concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Administrative costs and insurance prove pricey for personal trainers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A successful personal trainer is not limited to the number of customers or services. Administrative tasks, technical and insurance requirements are all important facets of being a personal trainer.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Labor is higher than capital in this industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Shifting Per Capita Disposable Income Adds to Revenue Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Throughout the period, per capita disposable income has brought volatility to industry revenue.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Growth of Personal Trainers Changes Habits and Direction of the Industry
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: With the pandemic changing how consumers work out, demand shifted from traditionally densely occupied gym facilities to private and smaller groups with personal trainers.

FAQs.question: How well does your company market to consumers with limited leisure time?
FAQs.answer: Industry players appeal to clients with limited leisure time by offering at-home personal training services.

FAQs.question: Does seasonality affect sales for the products and services your company offers?
FAQs.answer: The industry experiences highest demand during the first and second quarters of the year, since many consumers look to get into shape for the new year.

FAQs.question: If your company benefits from population density, are you located in high traffic areas to increase your exposure?
FAQs.answer: Personal trainers benefit from locating in highly populated areas to increase exposure.
